poem:
**The Missing Gear**

At forty-one, my midlife gears 
shift to thoughts of motorcycles.
Not the chrome or leather thrill,
but the silent hum of absence,
a road whispered between hedgerows,
the city breath held in.

London cyclists loop familiar routes,
dust motes in a globe shaken,
while my dreams idle,
waiting to rev into the wind.
